Data.event_text: 1 January  Colombia and Venezuela agrees to reopen the last remaining border that has been previously blocked by authorities due to worsening ties.

links.text: -"Venezuela, Colombia finalize border reopening". RFI. Retrieved 2 January 2022.-

Data.event_text: 20 January  A Dominican man who was lost in the Caribbean Sea for 24 days is rescued by the Colombian Navy.

links.text: -"'Help': Colombia rescues sailor adrift in Caribbean 24 days". AP NEWS. 2023-01-19. Retrieved 2023-01-20.-

Data.event_text: 19 January 12 February 2023 South American U-20 Championship

links.text: -"Campeonato Sudamericano sub 20 Colombia 2023: fechas y sedes del torneo". Antena 2 (in Spanish). 2022-09-20. Retrieved 2022-09-30.-

Data.event_text: 28 March  ELN rebels launch homemade mortar shells at a military base in El Carmen, Norte de Santander, killing nine soldiers and injuring nine others.

links.text: -"Militants kill 9 soldiers in attack on Colombia's military". ABC News. Retrieved 2023-04-07.-

Data.event_text: 1 May  a Cessna 206 light aircraft with seven people on board crashed in the jungle in the Caquetá Department, with the pilot and two adults died afterwards.

10 June  Having survived in the rainforest for 40 days, the remaining 4 passengers of the Cessna 206 aircraft, all children, were found and rescued by the Colombian military and rescuers and local volunteers.
3 August  Colombia and the National Liberation Army begin a six-month ceasefire aimed at creating peace between both sides.

links.text: -"Colombia begins a six-month cease-fire with its last remaining rebel group in hopes of forging peace". AP News. 2023-08-03. Retrieved 2023-08-04.-

Data.event_text: 4 September  Nine people are killed and five others are injured in clashes between FARC dissidents and the National Liberation Army in Arauca. It occurs as the army concludes a fourth round of peace talks with the government.

links.text: -AFP (2023-09-05). "Nine killed as Colombia guerrillas clash despite peace talks". The Daily Star. Retrieved 2023-09-05.-

Data.event_text: 20 September  A car bomb explodes near a police station in Timba, Cauca Department, killing two people and wounding two others.

links.text: -"At least two dead and two wounded in Colombian car bomb blast". La Presna Latina Media. 20 September 2023. Archived from the original on 21 September 2023. Retrieved 21 September 2023.-
-"At least two dead and two wounded in Colombian car bomb blast". La Presna Latina Media. 20 September 2023. Archived from the original on 21 September 2023. Retrieved 21 September 2023.-

Data.event_text: 14 October An annular solar eclipse will be visible in the Western U.S., Mexico, Central America, Colombia, and Brazil and will be the 44th solar eclipse of Solar Saros 134.

links.text: -"14 October 2023 — Great American Eclipse (Annular Solar Eclipse)".-

Data.event_text: 16 October Colombia requests the departure of the Israeli ambassador following Colombian President Gustavo Petro's remarks criticizing Israel's actions. In response, Israel suspends security exports to the South American nation.

links.text: -"Colombia demands Israel envoy leave amid spat over war with Hamas". RFI. 2023-10-16. Retrieved 2023-10-16.-

Data.event_text: 20 OctoberColombian President Gustavo Petro announces the establishment of an embassy to the State of Palestine in Ramallah, West Bank, and announces humanitarian aid to the Gaza Strip amidst the ongoing war.

links.text: -"Colombia to open embassy in Palestine: President". www.aa.com.tr. Retrieved 2023-10-20.-

Data.event_text: 27 October A retired Colombian army officer who participated in the 2021 assassination of Haitian president Jovenel Moïse is sentenced to life in a court in Miami.

links.text: -"Retired Colombian army officer gets life sentence in 2021 assassination of Haiti's president". AP News. 2023-10-27. Retrieved 2023-10-28.-

Data.event_text: 2 November Colombian Environment Minister Susana Muhamad announces plans to cull and sterilize around 166 hippopotamuses, descendants of those imported by drug lord Pablo Escobar, citing environmental concerns.

links.text: -"Pablo Escobar's feral hippos face cull in Colombia". BBC News. 2023-11-03. Retrieved 2023-11-03.-

Data.event_text: 22 December  Assassination of Jovenel Moïse A former Colombian soldier, Mario Antonio Palacios Palacios, pleads guilty to conspiring in the assassination of Haitian President Jovenel Moïse.

links.text: -"Former Colombian soldier pleads guilty in 2021 assassination of Haiti's president". AP News. 2023-12-22. Retrieved 2023-12-23.-

Data.event_text: 27 December  Colombia approves regulations that encourage local communities and indigenous groups to produce energy through renewable sources and sell it to the national grid.

links.text: -"Renewable energy drive for indigenous groups in Colombia". 2023-12-27. Retrieved 2023-12-27.-
